page.title: 05BASIL HILL BARRACKS,CORSHAM
page.content: Basil Hill Barracks are at Hudswell on the outskirts of Corsham. They are for training T.A.recruits,and are also used as a store base.The barracks were named after Major General Sir Basil Hill KBE CB DSO Director/Controller of Ordinance Services July 1936. Then in 1972, HQ RAOC T.A.returned. The Royal Army Ordinance Corps 1 consists of 1500 part_time volunteers they would go on several training camps at week_ends, but most of the training takes place at Hudswell.In the event of war,both regular and T.A. soldiers would be called up and issued with SLR's and respirators,combo pens,and their protective clothing,in which they could live up to five days. Then they would be transported to Germany. We all tried the assault course and enjoyed the challenge.
